body_html:
@orionr This seems to compile and install, I can import torch, caffe2, cv2. I need USE_FFMPEG and LMDB as I want to use R2Plus1D:
USE_FFMPEG=1 USE_OPENCV=1 USE_LEVELDB=0 USE_LMDB=1 python setup.py install

When I do: from caffe2.python import workspace I get CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: libcaffe2.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory now however.

Where is libcaffe2.so expected to be written too? It is not inside anaconda/lib/ and I don't see errors related to libcaffe2.so during running setup.py as described above.

USE_FFMPEG=1 USE_OPENCV=1 USE_LEVELDB=0 USE_LMDB=1 python setup.py install
When I do: from caffe2.python import workspace I get CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: libcaffe2.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory now however.
Where is libcaffe2.so expected to be written too? It is not inside anaconda/lib/ and I don't see errors related to libcaffe2.so during running setup.py as described above.
body:
@orionr This seems to compile and install, I can import `torch`, `caffe2`, `cv2`. I need USE_FFMPEG and LMDB as I want to use [R2Plus1D](https://github.com/facebookresearch/R2Plus1D/):
`USE_FFMPEG=1 USE_OPENCV=1 USE_LEVELDB=0 USE_LMDB=1 python setup.py install`

When I do: `from caffe2.python import workspace` I get `CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: libcaffe2.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory` now however. 

Where is `libcaffe2.so` expected to be written too? It is not inside `anaconda/lib/` and I don't see errors related to `libcaffe2.so` during running `setup.py` as described above.
